instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING
threads.message:
I test other keyboard but not working 
there is no liquids on touch pad or cables or connectors

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING
threads.message:
Keyboard information goes through trackpad circuitry.
So trackpad problem will also let keyboard unresponsive.
Check if J6701 gets all required voltages.
Be sure <CHIP>U6860</CHIP> and its resistors and traces are all good.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6860</CHIP> measurements
pin 1       1.8v    @ <RESISTOR>R6803</RESISTOR>
pin2        0v       @ 2pin   ************ <SIGNAL>SPI_TPAD_CLK</SIGNAL>    missed
pin 3       1.8v    @ 3pin
pin 4       1.8v    @ <RESISTOR>R4867</RESISTOR>
pin5        1.8v    @ 5pin
pin 9       3.3v    @ <RESISTOR>R6874</RESISTOR>
pin 10    3.3v     @ <RESISTOR>R6871</RESISTOR>
pin 11    0v        @ <RESISTOR>R6875</RESISTOR> ************ <SIGNAL>SPI_TPAD_3V3_CLK_R</SIGNAL>   missed
pin 12    3.3v    @ <RESISTOR>R6873</RESISTOR>

threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 97524, member: 682"]
Can you post useful information?
[/QUOTE]
now ok ?

<RESISTOR>R4852</RESISTOR> 20 OHM OK
<RESISTOR>R4715</RESISTOR> 2.9 KOHM  OK
<SIGNAL>SPI_TPAD_CLK</SIGNAL> impedance to GND at <RESISTOR>R4852</RESISTOR>  37 KOHM

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING

threads.message:
Did you check ohm value of the resistors <CHIP>U6860</CHIP> related?

?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A KEYBOARD AND TRACK PAD NOT WORKING
threads.message:
Voltages look good.

Tried known good trackpad flex/board?
